website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for added support or pain relief for all athletes.
pros: Licensee of the USA Olympic teams
Stays on for days if you need it to
cons: Each roll of this tape is nearly three times as expensive as other tapes on our list

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd Known About This Sooner
customer_reviews.text: My niece recommended this for my plantar fasciitis which has been horrible for 2 years. I watched the KT video online to make sure I used it correctly. The tape made a huge difference right away, and after about a week of the tape plus a stretching exercise I found, I was about 90% pain free. Now I'm using it on my sore elbow. The only downside is that no matter how carefully I apply it, the darn tape only stays on for about 2 days. The edges start peeling up within hours. I trim it off as it comes up. Still, it's worth it to relieve the pain in my foot. I've gone through 4 boxes so far.
customer_reviews.author: T. A. WhiteTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter plays VB and needed extra support for her knees through practices and games during the week. It didn't stay on very long for her, about 2 days then it started peeling at the edges. I had a groin strain and was skeptical about using this since it didn't work well for my daughter but didn't have other options since it was late. I taped late evening and the next morning my leg pain was minimal. I took the tape off after 4 days and it never once peeled off. I'm fully recovered and back to exercising.
customer_reviews.author: S. B.

customer_reviews.title: Soak in a bath and go really slowly or you'll end up with some painful battle scars
customer_reviews.text: If you were here looking for someone else who used this for binding here I am! I have about a 38 C chest these babies held me in tight for my cosplay. Just as long as you do it safely and for only a few hours this stuff if magical. However please be careful taking it off! Soak in a bath and go really slowly or you'll end up with some painful battle scars!
customer_reviews.author: Shotaouji_

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: I suggest doing a skin test of various colors. I wore the black for 5 days with no issue at all. This week, I tried the hot pink. Well, it did Not like me. Not only did it not want to stick, as it peeled; it took some skin with it. Then, come to find out, along with skin tear, I had an allergic reaction as well. As the inflammation backs off and the skin is healing, I see I've been left with the gift of of the tape pattern! As I said, no such issues with the black. Very odd
customer_reviews.author: nadine

customer_reviews.title: KT Tape Original Cotton Elastic Kinesiology Therapeutic Athletic Tape
customer_reviews.text: I love when my PT's put KT tape on. It feels so darn good and makes it a joy to walk again. It was easy to follow the instructions, but the tape didn't hold worth a da*n! So to make sure it wasn't me being a dunce, I took it to my PT yesterday, and today it's already coming off! Ugh! Looks like I'll have to use their buyer. The stuff they use sticks for a week no matter what you do (shower/bath makes no difference). The adhesive the PTs use is awesome. So now I know it's not just me. It's the tape. What a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Brekke (nee Isbell)

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it works. It doesn’t hurt to try.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly... I don’t know if it works or not. I use it on my various ankle injuries and recoveries. Sometimes I feel good after playing basketball wearing the tape, sometimes I don’t. I probably would get similar results without it, but who knows. It’s not like this miracle product where I really feel good using it. There could even be a placebo effect going on, but again, not sure. The one main reason I keep buying this stuff is because it’s covered by my fha flexible health spending account. I buy a bunch of stuff like this at the end of the year if I don’t meet my carry over amounts and I just hope it works!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive skin?
customer_reviews.text: I only got to try this one time. When I used it, I felt a little itchy but just assumed my skin was dry. When I took it off, I had a rash with the pattern of the tape left on my skin. It stayed on my skin for about a month. It almost looked like a burn. It was about 3 shades darker than my natural skin color and very apparent to the people I showed. After exfoliating for about 4-5 weeks, it finally faded and went away. I do not have sensitive skin, so I am on the disappointed side. I really wanted to try and like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been using KT tape for years. I just applied this new package from the seller this morning and already the ends are peeling up. I applied as instructed and as previously stated, I've used KT tape and other kinesthetic tape for years in multiple places on my body. Not sure if this package is old or just defective but I won't be purchasing from this seller again. I've used other brands of kinesthetic tape previously with the same results (they just aren't precut) and will be going back to those.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Magic Tape
customer_reviews.text: I have been using KT Tape for years now. My Physical Therapist introduced me to it after I had neck surgery. I know it’s hard to believe a piece of tape could help your pain/injury/soreness. All I can say is believe in Magic, you muggle. This stuff works. It worked on my neck muscles after major surgery. Since then I’ve used it on tennis elbow, plantar fasciitis, ankle strain and shoulder strain. Works every time. They have great YouTube videos showing exactly how to apply the tape for your specific issue. Try it once. You won’t be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Grasshopper

customer_reviews.title: Branding Reputation Exceeds Product's Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've always seen KT Tape and felt like it must be a really good product, because it's everywhere. However, I bought one of the off-brand's from Amazon last month and it was exceedingly better than this product. This product was peeling off within minutes of being applied....even used the friction technique. The support offered is very weak and I found myself using three strips versus the one or two with the competitor's product. The pre-cut is a little convenient, but only if the product works well. This is my last KT brand purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable!
customer_reviews.text: This tape really helps......within minutes! I had a sore/tight trapezius for days, and within 20 mins of watching the instruction video and applying just one strip to the top of my shoulder, the pain disappeared! Same success applying it to the back of my knee when my Baker's Cyst flared up. I've also used it with good results on my previously broken foot, and lower back. I've even shipped 4 rolls to a friend suffering for horrible upper back and neck problems.
customer_reviews.author: Carina M Muehl

customer_reviews.title: Stays stuck
customer_reviews.text: I have a torn meniscus and stretched ACL from a motorcycle crash. (rear ended by a texter) I only used the tape once to climb Mt Acetengo in Guatemala. I put the tape on as instructed the first morning before heading out, and despite everything from the heat and humidity of tropical cloud forest to the freezing temperatures of the summit it stayed stuck. I will definitely keep using it for hiking and climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Dewar

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought KT tape from Rite Aid. The crap that came from Amazon is NOT the real thing. It’s thinner, has less adhesive power, and it’s way too elastic. The original KT tape is elastic but not too elastic. When the user stretches the tape during application, it snaps back to pull right. This tape from Amazon doesn’t really provide that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: I don't know how it works but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on advice from my Massage/physical therapist daughter. My hubby was having knee pain so I said what the heck, I'll try it. I followed the YouTube video on how to apply it and hubby said it helped his knee pain right away. I don't know how this stuff works but he seemed better. So I tried it on my foot (following the YouTube instructions). I think its magic. I don't care that I don't know how it works, I'm just glad it temporarily helps the pain go away.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Total Knee Replacement
customer_reviews.text: My PT at UCLA recommended and applied KP tape to my knee. The purpose of the taping was to reduce swelling and fluid around my knee. KP tapes works. To apply the tape your leg must be dry. They recommended that my knee was bent when the tape was applied. The tape lasted 5 or 6 days without irritation or inhibiting my range of motion. I was able to do all my leg exercises without pain. The swelling and fluid dissipated.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Decent for recovery, not the best for activity
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an active tape, this is not your best option. It doesn't hold up very well during exercise. It falls off and gets loose within the first hour. If you're looking for a tape to use for recovery, this would work - just know you'll need to replace it after it gets wet (If you're trying to use in an ice bath or the like). The tape does allow for a good range of motion. I think this comes from it being a little more stretchy and thinner than other K-tapes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tore my skin
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give it a try after seeing some results with a sample product from Walmart. It was actually mueller Sports tape, although I’m pretty sure I’ve used KT tape before and I don’t remember having any issues. Anyways, I used it on my shoulder and it was terrible to take off. It even tore off some skin and after that I refused to use it. It also didn’t adhere completely and would roll and catch on literally anything. That was a pain like no other.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Fun to wear
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if this stuff actually did anything but it was a lot of fun to put on and wear. It is very stretch and will probably stick to your body all day provided there isnt too much friction at its edges. I would put this on my ankles under socks and work boots, they lasted most of my shift. If they run too much they can curl over on itself and then they basically become useless. If your curious about them, I say try them out.
customer_reviews.author: Arik

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as before
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if they changed the kind of material or what, but I've been using KT Tape for a long time. I've begun to experience pain in my knees again and thought I'd start taping again. I had a few strips from my last order but needed more so I did another order and there is a definite difference in the quality and adhesion of this new tape. It's thinner and does not adhere like it should. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Briggie

customer_reviews.title: Used for tight IT band
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a tight IT band while cycling in a spin class and it works great. Good support, breathable, and it lasts a couple of days. Removal is easy if you remove it in the same direction you laid it. This is of course if you have leg hair, if you don’t then no worries. This does not last or stick as well as the pro, but good for a day or two. For any tape job you need just look up on YouTube. The instructions that come with this are nice but the YouTube instructions are good.
customer_reviews.author: == true;

customer_reviews.title: I put it on exactly like the doc showed me
customer_reviews.text: My original introduction to KT tape came when I had to go to a foot doctor for Plantar Fasciitis. He showed me how to put the tape on and gave me a box of it. When I ran out of the tape I turned to Amazon to buy more. I purchased 3rolls and used it all in 1 month. It just wouldn’t stick to my foot. I put it on exactly like the doc showed me, but it kept falling off! I was very frustrated! So now I need more KT tape ( I use it when I work out at the gym). I won’t be buying it from Amazon. I am truly disappointed! Sherry
customer_reviews.author: Sherry H.

customer_reviews.title: Good continuous support
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t seem possible, but it does provide support. You do notice it over days of continuous wear. I don’t notice much difference between the cotton and the synthetic except the price! I have these on my knee. They stay on three maybe four days with showering every day; pat dry the area instantly coming out of the shower. I particularly like these because I can wear them under my dress pants with no bulk and still have support. I like the precut ones because the corners are rounded and I don't have to search for scissors. I buy the beige ones and wear with my shorts all the time!
customer_reviews.author: LauraAW

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have shoulder injury and I work for FedEx so you can imagine my pain but this stuff if you stretch it enough you can feel the support it gives on the area and I I for confident to do my job with the speed I'm required and I can keep it on for 3days with shower I never tried to keep it longer than that, the only thing is I dont know if I'm not waiting long enough to it to stick to my skin but in some areas the edges do lift up other than that I would recommend it and I will continue to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Shushu

customer_reviews.title: Good for Sensitive Skin + Effective for healing
customer_reviews.text: I have sensitive skin and this tape has never caused any irritation. The only time I had an issue was when I took the tape off before the 48 hour recommended time bc it's still very sticky, so be very careful during removal. Only deducting a star because the "stealth beige" color is only stealth for fair skin. Especially if you need K-tape on your knee while you're wearing a cocktail dress! Make inclusive skin shades, not everyone wants obnoxious colors! Some brown shades would be game changers.
customer_reviews.author: Pug Mom

customer_reviews.title: Burns skin
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this tape from here. I’ve used KT many times before without issue. This specific product gave me a rash that hasn’t gone away. Only wore tape for a few hours on Saturday and took off. It’s Tuesday and my skin has a rash in the same shape as the tape and is showing no signs of healing. Dr gave some recommendations for treatment so I’m hoping for results in the morning
customer_reviews.author: Christine Balaban

customer_reviews.title: Magical
customer_reviews.text: After reading about how well KT tape works I'd decided to give it a try. I've been doing some more intense hikes lately, and while poles have helped somewhat my knees were still taking a beating. I thought the tape would feel more restrictive or tight, but it was surprisingly comfortable (easy to forget it's there). Application was simple with the help of the company's YouTube video. I had ZERO knee pain on my last hike on Mt. March - NY's highest peak - and didn't even use my poles most of the day. Granted, Marcy isn't a difficult technical hike, but there were scrambles and it was almost 16 miles, so I am impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: I'll definitely be purchasing more of these!
customer_reviews.text: I don't give 5 start reviews however, this item deserves at least 4.5. I put them on after watching a video on You-tube and having had strained my back at work twice within 3 weeks, these have really made a big difference I'm no longer straining my lower back and can lift and work find all day long. Also they last more than one day which saves a ton of money over the ones that only last for a single use! I'll definitely be purchasing more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: No plastic container = GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that you’ll receive this tape in the regular KT tape box, but the roll is wrapped in cellophane rather than in the plastic cylinder container that protects the tape. I’m a regular KT tape user, so I had a plastic KT tape container from a previous purchase. Reducing plastic consumption USA good thing, so it didn’t bother me. The tape also doesn’t have the little printed lines on it (stretch measurement?). It works great though.
customer_reviews.author: Linda W

customer_reviews.title: Excellent staying power
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist used kinesio tape to help with my shoulder impingement. Her tape lasted about 4 days. I tried this so that I could tape it when I needed it. This tape last 5 or 6 days each time, even through showers. That said, I don't know what this tape is made of or how it works but it is a miracle. I use it for my hip and my knee as well. I could not live without this tape. I think it may be made with unicorn horns and pixie dust because it is magical.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Loya

customer_reviews.title: Not expensive useful for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I use that tape for my injured big toe. It’s very elastic and adhesive and holds a well. I don’t have any kind of rash after using that. It can be easily removed even without any help with any kind of oil or alcohol for that. It doesn’t stay longer than 1 day in my case, but it has a good price and enough strips so It’s ok for me. Using that helps me hold a healing position and relieving the pain during exercises or just walking.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya Pirogov

customer_reviews.title: Stays on even in the shower.
customer_reviews.text: KT tape is the best thing I've found to help keep my knees from hurting. I tape them and it stays on several days even after showering. I cut the strips in half and apply them under my knees like a smile. You have to smooth the tape down firmly to get the best adhesion. After a month of wearing the tape my knee pain is much less.
customer_reviews.author: EC Rabe

customer_reviews.title: A  Great Fix for People with Narrow Heels
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I buy shoes, I find because I have a narrow foot and narrow heel, that my foot slides. I've tried a lot of inserts in my shoes and mostly they don't work. But these are going to be great. They have great adhesive backing and they are puffy enough that they fill the space between my heel and the back of the shoe and they are comfortable on my heel. I put a pair in every closed shoe I own. I am excited that I can wear the shoes that I never wear because they are too big but only in the heel.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Iseman

customer_reviews.title: Adhesive reaction
customer_reviews.text: I have use KT tape in the past. But it was the pro version. I decided to try for the cotton version this time because it was less expensive. Unfortunately I have a tendency to react to adhesive. And I did with this particular tape so I had to return it. In addition it did not stick as well as the pro tape. So my suggestion is if you're looking for the best KT tape to go with the Pro Version. in closing I will say when I use the pro tape on my knees last year it made a tremendous amount of difference in the pain I was experiencing and it did eventually go away.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Itchy blisters
customer_reviews.text: Loved the product the first 24 hours. Then the adhesive started to let loose a bit and the edges rolled. On day 2 I had a sudden change and my skin started to itch uncontrollably and as I peeled it off as suggested, there were countless blisters underneath and the tape took my skin right off in a few spots.
customer_reviews.author: B Biermaier

customer_reviews.title: Better stuff out there than this! Not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: KT brand might come to mind but there are other brands much better! KT brand doesn't stick well. Try THERABAND KT tape. It holds on longer and the design shows you amount of stretch. Nice feature. Virtually the same or lower price! Same technology but much better. Used both for shoulder and neck support and the THERABAND is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Post Office Guy

customer_reviews.title: Kinesiology tape
customer_reviews.text: I love this tape. Really love it. I have a tendon on the outside of my foot that gets a lot of pressure because I have high arches. This hurts like heck - would say a stronger work but won't. I put this tape on and go for days, showering with it etc. I have had it on as long as 5 days with no skin shriveling like when you wear a band-aid. I truly love this stuff. Got my daughter and granddaughter using it (she plays softball and it helps with the soreness).
customer_reviews.author: P. RobbinsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Try it before you do ANY other pain therapy
customer_reviews.text: Best pain management tool I’ve used to include pain meds. This is instant relief and support. I’ve not received a cortisone injection in a year and I was begging to go more than every 3 months. Pain relief w/injections was short lived and still minimal pain for first few weeks, moderate after 3 and back to severe within 6-7 weeks. I’ve been using tape and NO pain once applied and can walk normally. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not as good as Rock Tape
customer_reviews.text: There's been a revolution in athletic taping over the past decade or so, and KT tape is one of the big players. I've used it and it works, but it's not as good as Rock Tape. In my events, I'm in and out of the water, for many hours on end. KT tape just doesn't remain in place once it gets wet. When not doing events, KT won't survive a shower or hand washing, Rock Tape does. The stretch of KT tape is also not quite as good as Rock Tape. Do yourself a favor and just go with Rock Tape.
customer_reviews.author: Faramir66103

customer_reviews.title: Not as sticky as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I feel like they changed the adhesive on this product because it no longer stays for an entire workout. I put it on before my workouts and try to help it adhere to the skin with some friction like I always have, but I inevitably starts peeling up during my workout and becomes completely ineffective. It’s a shame, because this product used to really help me and I am allergic to the stronger synthetic version.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Multi-Day use and pain reduction
customer_reviews.text: My step-daughter has been using this for shin-splint pain during volleyball indoors - she's found great relief with this tape and loves that it adheres well enough for 2-3 day use (including showers!). I think she is using baby oil to help remove it before reapplication. She's very happy with it and I've already bought 3 rolls. The pre-cut strips are nice, but if you have a long season ahead, perhaps an econo-roll is a better bet.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed.
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different colors of KT tape for different injuries on myself and family members. The different colors seem to vary in stickiness. I bought the blue and pink because they were on sale (I usually use black). This one does not stay on longer then a few hours! Sometimes it even peels off right after I place it! I have tried rubning it in place, cleaning the skin with alcohol and letting it dry before hand and putting several layers on but nothing seems to work. It also stained my skin which took a few days to return to normal. Do not order this one. You will be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: diana beach

customer_reviews.title: It really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tape as a last resort. I've tried everything else... really thought this was a gimmick... how could this little bit of stretchy tape do what no other brace could ?! ... but desperation will try anything.... amazing pain relief! Played golf and worked out this am and pain negligible because that darn thumb is immobilized... easy... fast... and CHEAP ..... SO happy....
customer_reviews.author: Carmela F. Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: Terrible adhesive
customer_reviews.text: The glue sticks to the skin really hard but it doesn't stay on the tape. So after couple hours after applying it, the tape comes off and the glue stays "tattooed" onto the skin for days. I tried to peel the glue off but it literally peeled my skin off with it and I have bruises from it. I've tried using it at least 4 times but it's a big no no for me.
customer_reviews.author: MarinaH

customer_reviews.title: Does not stick as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Kinesiology Tape to help with Plantar Fasciitis. I actually think it helps but it just does not stick as expected when wet. Do not buy this if you want to swim with it. My work around is to wear a nylon compression sock when swimming and to tape the edges with luekotape. This may be OK if kept dry, but I will be looking for a different brand to try for better wet adhesion.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey G.

customer_reviews.title: They don't stay stuck
customer_reviews.text: I did everything they said to do, no cream on leg etc. I even rubbed my leg with alcohol and water 15 minutes before I applied the tape to my knee. I rubbed the tape real good so it would stick by the end of the day it was dangling off my leg, not very pretty. I had high hopes for this tape. It just doesn't stick like they say it does.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: It helps alot
customer_reviews.text: This tape helps. I broke the top bones of my foot several years ago . I have discovered the taping me to significant difference. Unfortunately, I can’t wear it forever because it’s not great for my skin, but using these pre-cut sections allows me freedom to take it off and put it on easily. I wish the adhesion was better. It tends to roll a bit. Nevertheless, this is my go to
customer_reviews.author: Sophie15

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely Does Help With Pain
customer_reviews.text: This product in many ways has made my life easier. I have suffered from scoliosis and asthma for most of my life. Due in part to both of these, I end up with pain along my spine and pulled muscles/misplaced ribs. Once I got the hang of getting the tape in the right places, I can confidently say that it has made the pain much more manageable. I have recommended this product to many of my friends and colleagues and always get positive results. Watch some videos on applying in certain areas if you're having any trouble. Will continue to use this product as long as I need it.
customer_reviews.author: EL

customer_reviews.title: Adhesive caused an allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: Warning: the adhesive caused a serious allergic reaction. I've never seen my skin react like this to anything else: everywhere it touched me is a burning welp. If you try it, do a small test patch, wait 24 hours, remove and wait 24 hours
customer_reviews.author: A K

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective if not adhesive
customer_reviews.text: The worst KT tape I’ve used yet! Simply put, it just doesn’t adhere. AT ALL. Clean , dry skin, nope it just starts to pull away within minutes. I’ve used many other brands and types of kt tape but these were precut into manageable applications, and yes that is a nice feature. Trying to cut KT tape can be tricky. But if it doesn’t adhere even in the most controlled environment, the product is ineffective, you will never get the benefits. Precut is only a perk, if the product works. And without proper adhesión it does not. I’ll be on the hunt for my old brands , never plan on buying this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This does not seem to be a very good tape anymore
customer_reviews.text: I don't think we are very happy with this tape anymore. We had used this in the past and there were not any issues, but my wife has been having shoulder problems for a bit now and so we started using this tape again and it really does not seem to be the same tape as it used to be. It does not last long at all now. We have even made sure her skin was all clean and ready to go and nothing seems to help. We have bought another brand and are now hoping to find better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Needs to stick to the skin better.
customer_reviews.text: This tape does help relieve pain in muscles, but it doesn’t stay on very well. I put it on then have to take off throw away and start again. I press it, rub it, even tried my blow dryer on hot to get it to stay on. So I payed the extra money for the sport, it was worse. I still get it because it does help, and sometimes I get lucky and it stays on for 2-3 days, even after showers, but it’s hit and miss. If it stuck better I would haven given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Educate

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself sports training
customer_reviews.text: My son has had a tough time during football season with a pulled hamstring. We purchased this to try to manage the pain and avoid further injury during the season. The KT Tape plus a tight wrap has helped stabilize the injury and allowed him to play. There are great videos available online to ensure you are taping properly and there is no need for a sports trainer to do it for you!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Works BUT
customer_reviews.text: If i could give this more stars I would. I swear by this stuff and never like to be without it. I have THE tightest traps in the world and as soon as i apply this tape it’s like a bathtub was lifted off my shoulders. I notice instant relief. It also helps my headaches. I took off one star because the stuff is impossible to remove. It’s peeled off tiny pieces of my skin in some instances. But I still use it because tiny bits of skin is a small price to pay for instant relief when you’re desperate and nothing else will help
customer_reviews.author: Noneya Bisniss

customer_reviews.title: THAT I COULD WALK WITHOUT PAIN !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT REALLY WORKS !!!. A PHYSICAL THEARAPY PLACE DID THIS TAPE ON MY KNEE AND I COULD BELEIVE HOW THIS WORKS,I COULD WALK WITHOUT PAIN.THIS IS NO JOKE.I PUT THIS TAPE ON A FRIEND'S KNEE AND HE COULD NOT BELEIVE IT.THIS DOES NOT TAKE THE PLACE OF SURGERY BUT FOR MINOR PAIN ITS GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE A SNARSKI

customer_reviews.title: Not as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product for some foot pain related to plantar fasciitis. I chose this product because it was advertised as lasting both 5 days and being waterproof. It is neither. Half way through the day I could feel it coming undone on the sole of my foot. Not 2 minutes into a hot shower and over half of it was coming off. This product was a complete waste of time and money for me. I wish I had bought this at a local retailer so I could have at least returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs Jones

customer_reviews.title: Pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: Loved! I used this when I was pregnant I had pelvic girdle pain. I had it so bad I couldn’t move some days. This help so much! It was comfortable and honestly couldn’t tell it was there. It stuck amazing and I even wore it in the shower and I feel like it may have made it stuck better. So be prepared for it to kinda hurt when taking off. Other than that I LOVE.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This tape is effective if applied in the proper manner (go online to get instruction technique). Have used it a number of times for neck pain. It does not cure the problem...it provides some relief while you are engaged in the sport or activity that you are doing...it more or less protects the muscle. tendon . etc. while you are engaged in the activity.
customer_reviews.author: Dan R. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great for those aching knees
customer_reviews.text: This is a product I always have on hand. Easy to use and very affective. The last container I went to use and my husband had used the last one and didn’t tell me. My next order was two boxes one for him and one for me. If you have bad knees or ankles these really get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Anydots

customer_reviews.title: Fair value.
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in new condition,well packaged. I used this product to support my knee where the connective tissue at the quad area is damaged giving me pain caused by the stress of running. The directions were simple. The product worked well. Rest along with this product has helped in a recovery. Knee pain is nearly gone completely.
customer_reviews.author: acamus

customer_reviews.title: It actually works
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much, but it had good reviews snd relatively inexpensive. I am surprised it actually works better than any splints I've bought over the years. Helps muscles, ligaments, ans joints. I'm aure it probably won't helo everything, but this gives me stability and relief.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Bucholz

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as good as prior purchases of the same tape.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using KT Tape for two years for my bad knees. The first four tapes from this roll had very little adhesive. I get at least one week per tape application, but these started detaching at the ends within the first hour of the application before I had dressed or put any stress whatsoever on the taped areas. There was no reason for it; I had applied as I always do. I did not check the package for an expiration date, and I do not know if there is one. There was no indication of moisture or anything else that may have caused the issue. Fluke?
customer_reviews.author: Albs

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Pro Version Instead
customer_reviews.text: These are nothing like their Pro cousin. Tried this because it was slightly less expensive than the pro version but it was a huge mistake. They peel off after less than a day and just won't stay on my skin. The pro version I can leave on for days without even the edges peeling and they even survive the shower. Not sure why these are even made when the pro version is so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good adhesion, worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: good that the corners are rounded and there's just enough of a tiny lip to the backing paper that it's easy to remove without having to tear it. Could have used better demonstration of the various locations and application methods but overall very easy to use and worked extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Marla Haney

customer_reviews.title: KT Tape is Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I sprained my wrist and discovered the miracle that is KT Tape. I purchased an extra roll just in case. Honestly, I have never used any product that truly lived up to its description that way KT Tape does. I find the type that I can tear off as needed to be best, but a larger area of injury might require the unbroken roll. The price is terrific, too. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. F.

customer_reviews.title: Meh, works but doesnt stick long
customer_reviews.text: I have used other brands but decided to go with KT and got the precut strips. While it is easy to use, works for relief it doesn't stick well at all. Skin prepped ( leg shaved, dryed and rubbed with alcohol to clean again) and I did not end with tape on tape . Still didnt stay on for more than 4-6 hours. Not sweating either, did not get wet. I am a bit dissapointed as this is " the brand" .
customer_reviews.author: Heather Coleman

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This tape doesn’t have the tension that the professional grade KT has. It also doesn’t adhere very well, perhaps because it isn’t as wide as the professional grade tape. I use the tape for plantar fasciitis, & it saved me on a backpacking trip last year. I will not use this tape again & have to order the professional grade tape. Live & learn!
customer_reviews.author: Susan E. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Kt Tape
customer_reviews.text: Kt Tape is the worst tape ever. I did everything it said to do. I got rid of hair, clean leg with soap & water, then i used Alcohol to wipe and grease off leg and hip. I put it on just like Kt Tape YouTube video shows step by step. Less than a 1/2 hour i start sweating and the tape shriveled up and started coming off. I am very upset about there Product. I feel they have false advertisement and false testimonies. This product needs to be pulled off shelves... I give them no stars, and a F- rating.
customer_reviews.author: rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Descend like a mountain goat
customer_reviews.text: This tape is awesome if you have knee pain for steep ascents and descents. The tape does not stick so well for me, but if I give it enough friction on the ends it will stay on for the whole hike. I watched YouTube videos to figure out an application that works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: First off, I ordered black and got beige so that was a disappointment. Second, the box and reviews all said it stays in 3-4 days. It didn’t even stay in a couple of hours. Note..I used it on my legs and ankles. I’d put it on and within minutes sometimes it would be coming off and never stayed on past a sweaty workout let alone 3-4 days. The strips were nice and long and it did feel good when it was first applied and I was able to bend my knee when it stretched all the way up my lower leg but other than that, I have been super disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: love to shop

customer_reviews.title: Helps with plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: KT tape has been the one thing that reliably helps my plantar fasciitis and allows me to run without pain. I have also used it for calf strains with success. Just be sure to follow instructions, the do have very helpful videos if you are unsure how to apply. The non waterproof will only really last a day at best, but I generally use for a few hours then remove. Take your time applying so you dont have any bumps (especially if applying somewhere like your foot where it may rub on your shoe).
customer_reviews.author: Mel Liddle

customer_reviews.title: Injury?  The KT Tape is a Must to use!!
customer_reviews.text: I injured my knee, had Physical Therapy and the therapist used this type of elastic tape to help support my knee. He recommended that I look for, and purchase KT Tape, which I did at a Sports Store.... It was so expensive, I looked for KT Tape thru amazon.com and found it! I was so Happy and purchased the KT Tape immediately! I highly recommend this tape for pain and injuries!! You really Must clean the area, use Alcohol and dry it before applying the tape. Great stuff!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Pemberton

customer_reviews.title: Works like its supposed to
customer_reviews.text: When applied correctly it does work. I think it could stick a little longer however the areas I'm using it is high abrasion and sweat so I'm sure that is a factor. I have been mostly using it on my foot for "turf toe" and it works but it only lasts 2 days at best. Used it for my shoulder too for "bicep tendonitis" it also worked and stuck around a little longer in that area.
customer_reviews.author: Adam & Amy

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. I’m at the gym daily, I’m messing something up in my body daily too. “Loose joints”, hyper-mobility and whatnot. It’s insane how much better everything fees after a couple days with the KT tape. It certainly feels better WITH than without. My applications have been given to me be my dr/physical therapist. They’re easy enough for me to do and they stay well.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Grudain

customer_reviews.title: not the best
customer_reviews.text: I have used the KT tape before but have alway purchased the Pro. This particular tape does not stay on well for me. I tape my ankle and sometimes my knees for running and it rarely is still completely on when I'm finished and that's with using the Mueller spray first. Don't get me wrong, it does the job but not as well as the pro. The Pro KT tape can stay on for several days and several showers where the regular tape cannot. From now on, I will spend the extra money and go with the Pro KT tape
customer_reviews.author: Alohatrbl

customer_reviews.title: Got use of my hand back !
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after being diagnosed with De Quervain's tenosynovitis I had a brace specially made for me and I couldn’t move with it on. I was worried I would have to get shots to help with the pain. These tapes did the trick. I wasn’t able to wash my hair, put my hair up or even write prior to buying these. Thought I would never be able to use my right hand again, which is my dominate hand ! 2 weeks of using just the tape, without a brace or wrap and now I have my hand back with NO pain!! It’s amazing !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for wrist pain relief!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this product. I have bad carpal tunnel and there are some days where a wrist brace doesn't support every area that you're feeling pain in. You can place the tape exactly where you need the support and chose how tight/loose the fit is. The tape is also a more discreet wrist brace that doesn't come with ANY bulkiness of a brace. You're able to use a mouse and keyboard without having an inch of material under your wrists that make it difficult to use a mouse or keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Pale Cascade

customer_reviews.title: do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: dont waste money on this, reviews stated be careful with skin irritation or skin peeling, i didnt have those issues, it just didn’t want to stay on after like 5 min after use, not worth the headache, great that they were able to refund me my money though
customer_reviews.author: Judy Ramires

customer_reviews.title: Easy to remove and not that painful
customer_reviews.text: Adhesion is good for a day. The pain relief is something that is more important to me and it does the job to ease the pain on my knees while running. This is the cheapest precut and the best bang for your buck. I would Recommend this if you don’t need adhesion that last for days and not painful to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Roemar C.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best... just OK
customer_reviews.text: This is okay. I wouldn't purchase again. The adhesion is definitely not the best. The quality of this overall is just okay. It cannot nor does it stay on especially if you wet it, and as far as releasing pain if you can get it to stay on it does semi give relief.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have used KT Tape many times and this is the first time I have been disappointed with it. The adhesive does not work as well as ones I have bought in the past. I am usually able to wear 2-3 days and even after showering. I'm lucky if I get 1/2 day out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this item, please.
customer_reviews.text: I used it around my knee according to instructions and three days later I got a horrible irritation behind the knee with a lot of itching. I will not post the picture out of respect for your visual sensibilities. Terrible! It also barely did the job of immobilizing the movement. This is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Texan GS

customer_reviews.title: Great except doesn’t stick after hand washing.
customer_reviews.text: So. I have osteoarthritis in my CMC joint. Super common. Evidence-based research proves that tape therapy helps this particular joint. The tape is great. The price is awesome. But major points deducted due to lack of adhesion after washing my hands. I have these on both hands and after one hand wash, the tape is peeling off around my thumbs and palms. I’ll look for water proof tape the next order. Bummer. It’s a pain to put on and was hoping it would stay on for 3 days at least.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Morgan

customer_reviews.title: FIRM BELIEVER OF KT TAPE
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE KT tape so much!! The only downfall is that it can be pricey if you use it a lot. When I was pregnant I put it on my feet/ankles, lower back, my stomach (instead of wearing a maternity belt), and my wrist because pregnancy was giving me carpal tunnel. This stuff is really amazing for any type of injury or body ache. GREAT you-tube videos for EVERY single part of your body!!! Love the attractive colors when I wear it at the gym and did I add super SOFT and COMFORTABLE TAPE!!
customer_reviews.author: Farrah

customer_reviews.title: Life changing!
customer_reviews.text: This tape is awesome. Don't know exactly how it works but my injured ankle felt WAY better after putting it on. Wearing it for 12 hours so far and I'm going to continue wearing it until the fracture heals - - so for another 4 weeks. It's soo comfortable. It's like it has instant healing properties!
customer_reviews.author: amazonaddict

customer_reviews.title: Valuable product for injuries needing chronic support.
customer_reviews.text: Surgical site of bone deterioration in lower leg and ankle. After painful recovery areas continue to be sensitive and eventually stiffness and mobility issues developed. KT was introduced after rehabilitation therapy to gird up ankle and lower leg surgical site. Keeps blood flowing and supports pressure from walking. Going on 6 years and grateful for KT.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this! I originally bought a knock off version and the adhesive barely lasted 2 days. I can keep KT tape on my knee for a week if I wanted. And thats with wearing leggings, showering daily, and being highly active. Great product. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Manjit Golden

customer_reviews.title: breast reconstruction
customer_reviews.text: I have uses this product for various muscle aches and pain works very well. The last few roll I purchased I used for nerve ending pain, I have had 11 surgeries with the 1st being a bilateral masctomy, the rest to follow that were extremely painful as all your nerve ending have to regenerate. I was given every pain med possible with no relief. I used the KT tape as if I had a broken ribs with almost immediate pain relief. My plastic surgeon was kinda suprised that I use it. I have also been using it to correct some odd shape of my breast down the center of my chest with great success.
customer_reviews.author: carin jones

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these for arch support during yoga and everyday ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for arch support during yoga and everyday wear under socks for added support. Sadly, even with following directions, this did not last an entire day of basic activity- the adhesive did not stick. The second use, I wore them to a vinyasa yoga class, the tape ripped and loosened with increased movement and sweat. Does not live up to the description of 1-3 day use or wearing in the shower as described. Would not suggest purchasing this if you're looking for days of wear or sweat during your workout.
customer_reviews.author: Mella924

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stretch much or adhere well
customer_reviews.text: I estimate this not stretching more than around 35%, and compared with the higher-priced tape I know a little better does not stick well at the ends to clean, dry, albeit hairy skin---while adhering _very_ well to the hair. Sometimes 'inexpensive' is not the same as 'cheap'; in this case....
customer_reviews.author: Doktor_Polidori

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased KT tape based on a recommendation after I sprained my ankle and needed some extra support as I was healing. It works well and helps to stabilize. It does tend to curl up around the edges fairly quickly if any moisture is present. I ended up having to buy another brand one day when I ran into a sporting goods store and they did not have KT brand. The stuff I bought there was what I'm assuming was an off brand/house brand kinesiology tape. I actually liked that one much better because it stayed on my skin, even through a shower.
customer_reviews.author: Phill2d

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! Recently went on trip overseas with lots of walking, and have a bad knee! This was a godsend! I was able to tape my knee and function without excruciating pain. It was very hot and humid, so occasionally the tape loosened on the edges, but really worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Brackett

customer_reviews.title: Pink color won't stick
customer_reviews.text: I bought two colors. Blue and pink. Blue is fine. Stays on but pink color is awful. It won't stay on at all. Tried several times. Will be replacing it. Don't know if was a bad batch. I have really sensitive skin and this tape doesn't bother me so will be replacing it and hopefully it will stick
customer_reviews.author: dhs

customer_reviews.title: Not for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I would strongly recommend this product for anyone who has any type of soreness or even stiffness. The only reason I gave it 4 stars vs 5 stars is for those who have sensitive skin. I removed tape in the shower and used water to safely peel the tape off but it still gave me a rush burn. I scabbed up in the area where the tape was.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Bollat

customer_reviews.title: So over rated!!!
customer_reviews.text: It never sticks!!! It doesn’t matter what I do, after an hour of running, it starts to flap in the wind! It’s ridiculous! I only bought it because the other tape I usually buy that’s half the price, was sold out. KT tape is ridiculously over priced and over rated!
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Love the product supports my injury very well and pain goes away immediately after placing product on... BUT I can’t wear this product for a period of time it rips my skin after a full day of work or play (ouch)
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: This is mho
customer_reviews.text: Been using kt tape since 2004- so I know it works- the product I received has poor adhesion to my clean of oil area- I’m half way through the row and this particular batch is terrible - maybe quality control is to blame- this is mho
customer_reviews.author: VIP808

customer_reviews.title: Helps but tricky to put on
customer_reviews.text: I used another more expensive kt tape that was thicker and sturdier so that might have been hard for me to compare them fairly. This one is thinner and the pre cut pieces are longer so it was hard to put it on myself. Once it was on it did feel better and more supported than nothing. But next time I will pay more to get a more sturdy one.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy C.

customer_reviews.title: Fell off quickly!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product! There must be an issue with the adhesion material, it lasted less time than a bandaid! It had such great reviews, the only thing I can think of is there was a quality problem with this batch. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapz

customer_reviews.title: Works great but starts to peel off after a shower
customer_reviews.text: I use this tape for extensor tendinitis in my foot (basically one strip cut into two on my foot then one whole strip going up my shin). It works really well. The only issue for me is it starts to peel off some after a shower, even if I try my best to keep it from getting soaked and dry it off after. I also tend to have more sensitive skin so it starts to feel irritated under the tape after a day of use (but there's no actual rash or visible irritation). Overall, for me, it's been great for 1-day use but it doesn't last me long if I wear it every day (like I'm supposed to).
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: This tape works just a I needed it to. ...
customer_reviews.text: This tape works just a I needed it to. I usually put it on as much as a day or as little as an hour before I need it and I've never had any problems with it slipping off. And actually I've had to put a little effort to peel it off 3 days (and multiple showers and runs) later, so the stick holds really well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Torres

product_meta.title: KT Tape Original Cotton Elastic Kinesiology Therapeutic Athletic Tape, 20 Pack, 10” Cut Strips
product_meta.description: KT (Kinesiology Therapeutic) Tape is a strong, elastic athletic tape. Perfect for athletes, weekend warriors, and everyone with sore muscles. KT Tape?? provides muscle pain relief, increased mobility, and enhanced recovery. Can be worn for up to 4 days per application. Includes 20 Kwik Strips?? per roll. Length: 2" x 16.4'.
feature_bullets: WHAT IS KT TAPE? – Elastic sports tape used by pro and serious athletes to support muscles, joints, tendons, and ligaments. It’s drug-free, latex-free, hypoallergenic, lightweight, breathable, comfortable, HSA/FSA approved, and easy to use.

HOW DOES IT WORK? – It helps reduce tissue pressure and support muscles and joints. Studies show it helps you recover faster from pain. Used for knee pain, shoulder pain, shin splints, back pain, plantar fasciitis, tennis elbow, and much more.

EASY TO USE – Easy to self-apply using our free application videos (see our site) for common injury areas.  Our Taping Basics video teaches you how to help the tape stick properly, and our 60+ videos help you apply it for your area of pain.

TRUSTED BY PROFESSIONALS – Relied on by professional and Olympic athletes, athletic trainers, and medical professionals to train longer and finish stronger. Used heavily by Team USA, NBA Trainers Association, US Soccer, USA Triathlon, and more.

KT Tape products are Hypoallergenic, Latex-Free, Natural Rubber-Free! This means that our products have been designed and developed to contain fewer potential substances that can trigger allergic reactions

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
